p: Unsaturated fatty acids include omega-9 (ω-9; n-9) monounsaturated fatty acids and omega-3 (ω-3; n-3) and omega-6 (ω-6; n-6) polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) [ 151]. Omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids, including alpha-linolenic (ALA), linoleic (LA) and gamma-linolenic (GLA) acids, included among the essential fatty acids (EFAs), are of significant dietary and cosmetic importance ( Figure 5) [ 152].
